instructions: Ask the patient to report the number of falls in the last four weeks or in the last six months if it has been more than four weeks since a visit. In addition, ask the patient to report the number of falls in the last 12 months that resulted in an injury and required medical attention.
overview: The Fall History is a patient report on the number of falls.
population: The intended population includes any individuals at risk for falls.
references:
1. Miller WC, Speechley M, Deathe B. The prevalence and risk factors of falling and fear of falling among lower extremity amputees. Arch Phys Med Rehabil. 2011;82(8):1031-1037.
2. Hafner BJ, Smith DG. Differences in function and safety between Medicare Functional Classification Level-2 and -3 transfemoral amputees and influence of prosthetic knee joint control. J Rehabil Res Dev. 2009;46(3):417-434.
3. Kahle JT, Highsmith MJ, Hubbard SL. Comparison of nonmicroprocessor knee mechanism versus C-Leg on Prosthesis Evaluation Questionnaire, stumbles, falls, walking tests, stair descent, and knee preference. J Rehabil Res Dev. 2008;45(1):1-14. 
4. Lord SR, Sherrington C, Menz HB, et al. Falls in Older People: Risk Factors and Strategies for Prevention (2nd ed.). New York, USA: Cambridge University Press, 2011.
score_calculation: The number of falls is reported as a whole number response.
